Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Femoral Head Size in Total Hip Arthroplasty

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised, blinded trial involved 60 female patients aged 55-70 years

Participants.evidence: 60 female patients aged 55-70 years with primary hip arthritis, conducted at a single orthopedic center

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised into three groups of 20 to receive a 28-mm, 36-mm ceramic-on-crosslinked polyethylene, or â‰¥42-mm metal-on-metal bearing couple

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to compare the effects of different femoral head sizes on gait parameters and hip function in total hip arthroplasty (THA)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was spatiotemporal gait parameters at 4 months

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors

Number_Randomised.evidence: This randomised, blinded trial involved 60 female patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: The mean difference in spatiotemporal parameters was not significant (p > 0.05)

Trial_Registration.evidence: The study was registered under trial number [Trial Registration Number]
